question: Who was the Indian cricketer who took most wickets in the 1983 Cricket World Cup, in which India won its first "Cricket World Cup Champion" title?
explanation: Roger Binny was the Indian cricketer who took most wickets in the 1983 Cricket World Cup. The 1983 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '83) was the 3rd edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 9 to 25 June 1983 in England and Wales and was won by India, in which India won its first "Cricket World Cup Champion" title.
